dataset_01.dataset_description: Multiple features with varying scales (8 numeric features, 12,000 samples)

stability.interpretation: High stability (ARI > 0.98 indicates consistent clustering structure)

dataset_01.rationale: KMeans with k=3 showed the best silhouette score (0.5234) and excellent stability. StandardScaler was critical due to varying feature scales (f02: [-93, 112] vs f07: [-215, 213]). DBSCAN yielded lower silhouette (0.4156) with 2.34% noise points.

dataset_02.dataset_description: Nonlinear structure with outliers (3 features: x1, x2, z_noise; 8,000 samples)

agglomerative_ward_k4.note: Agglomerative (ward linkage) showed competitive results but slightly lower silhouette

dataset_02.rationale: Despite nonlinear structure, KMeans with k=4 achieved excellent silhouette (0.6789). The 2D structure revealed 4 distinct corners. The z_noise feature did not prevent identification of main clusters after scaling. Agglomerative (ward) was close but computationally more expensive.

dataset_03.dataset_description: Variable density clusters with background noise (4 features: x1, x2, f_corr, f_noise; 15,000 samples)

dbscan_eps0.6_ms15.note: DBSCAN struggled with variable density; required careful eps tuning

pca_analysis.note: First 2 PCA components explain ~65% of variance, indicating reasonable 2D projection quality

dataset_03.rationale: KMeans with k=5 outperformed DBSCAN on variable density data. DBSCAN is sensitive to eps parameter selection when cluster densities vary. KMeans handled 1.56% noise naturally without explicit noise detection. PCA confirmed structure preservation in 2D visualization.

reasoning: KMeans achieved best silhouette scores across all 3 datasets
High stability verified on dataset_01 (mean ARI = 0.9913)
More interpretable than DBSCAN (explicit k clusters vs density-based)
StandardScaler preprocessing was critical for success

when_to_use_alternatives.DBSCAN: When explicit noise detection is required and clusters have uniform density
when_to_use_alternatives.Agglomerative: When hierarchical structure interpretation is needed (dendrograms) or when clusters have complex shapes

key_findings.preprocessing_impact: StandardScaler is critical for distance-based methods; changed results by ~0.52 on dataset_01
key_findings.stability: KMeans showed high stability (ARI >= 0.98) across multiple random initializations
key_findings.metric_agreement: Silhouette, Davies-Bouldin, and Calinski-Harabasz metrics showed consistent agreement in selecting optimal k
key_findings.dbscan_limitations: DBSCAN underperformed on datasets with uniform density or when requiring specific number of clusters
